website_summaries.verdict: A simple wireless thermostat that is perfect for people looking for a basic unit with some advanced features.
pros: Easy to set up and work
Can connect with personal assistant devices like Alexa for voice control over the wireless connection
cons: Lacks some convenience features other units have

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Much of this is copied from another review. I had the same experience. My unit worked excellent when I installed it in the summer, the AC could be controlled wirelessly/remotely with my iPhone using the app. I setup schedules using the app, it would maintain temperatures and operate according to the schedule. It was flawless. However once winter came, the heat would continue to cycle until I shut it off from the breaker box and would restart the moment I turned it back on. We woke up 3 times with the house in the mid-high 80s. I have since installed a Nest and it works perfectly heating and cooling.
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: The up and down buttons on here are soft yet responsive and sturdy. This unit beats their touch screen unit hands ...
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money to upgrade to this. Being able to turn the heat up from your cold bed in the morning is invaluable! The up and down buttons on here are soft yet responsive and sturdy. This unit beats their touch screen unit hands down. Physical buttons plus wifi! The instructions can be tricky to set up wifi but once it is set it is worth it. Remember this unit requires a "C" wire that may be hanging somewhere unused if your current thermostat uses batteries. This was an extra unexpected step for me that youtube videos helped me to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars I would. Do yourself a favor and buy a nest or newer type wifi thermostat. This can only connect to a 2.4ghz router. Some broadcast in both frequencies, but you will get an error code if you try to connect to your 5G band. That's just one of the many problems with this thermostat. I work in IT and I have never seen any device require as many steps as this device to get connected to my wifi network. I really regret buying this thermostat and wish I had paid more money to get a nest. You really get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Extended service outage
customer_reviews.text: As of 9/24/2018, Honeywell's servers have been down for 36 hours -- the mobile app accepts your changes but does not sync them to the thermostat. Honeywell phone and twitter support is apologetic and acknowledges the problem, but offers no timeline for resolution. Edit 10/9/2018: The outage ended up being over 48 hours. I replaced the thermostat with a different brand 12 days ago, and Honeywell's service JUST noticed that the old one is offline. Totally unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Random1234

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat good, Honeywell bad
customer_reviews.text: Really is a great thermostat. Works well with the app. Looks nice. The only problem and its a huge problem is honeywell themself. Should you have a problem with the thermostat and need to replace it under warranty you're screwed. Honeywell will make you jump through multiple hoops, giving different addresses to send the thermostat and in the end you wont hear from them for months if at all. Now i don't have a thermostat and cant get a refund on amazon because honeywell still has the thermostat. It really is a great thermostat but buy from a company that actually cares about the customer.
customer_reviews.author: David Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Calling an item NEW when really USED
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item and once received I could tell it had been open. The thermostat on Amazon showed to be “New”. It didn’t concern me that much because all the parts and pieces were there and looked to be new. About a month later I went to install, register the thermostat and set up on WiFi and is said it was registered to another user. This confirmed my suspicion that it was used. I had to call Honeywell to have it unregistered so I could set it up. BUYER beware of packaging that appears to be opened. Also, AMAZON supposedly “inspected” the package. 😡
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Free filters!
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, registering my $70 thermostat (required to use the wifi functionality), they decided to send me a promo for a filter subscription with the first order free. So, I told them I have 4 filters, got the most expensive ones (which are probably worth $10 each (they say $17). Once they ship, I'll cancel the subscription. So, there you have it, free filters. Now, as for the thermostat, it sets temp, holds temp, and is adjustable via Alexa (after adding the skill) and from my phone using their app (whether I'm home or not). Decent price, decent thermostat, and $40 in free filters. I can't complain!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Snow

customer_reviews.title: Great unit but doesn’t work well with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: No instructions at all about how to connect to Alexa or any other smart device. I figured it out but Alexa doesn’t work right with it. If I want to change the AC to 72 degrees I have to tell Alexa to set the temp to 74 and it responds “auto is keeping the temperature between 72 and 76”. I contacted Honeywell via chat and they told me it is not their problem and it has to be Alexa. But it is not the Alexa screwing up. I gave up and now just tell Alexa to set the temp 2 degrees higher than I want and it works. The rest of the unit is great though.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I putchased it to replace my honeywell thermostat that's non wifi because I wanted the ability to control it from my phone and with alexa. Since my current thermostat was a honeywell and kind of recent model it already had a C wire, all I had to do was transfer it to the new thermostat. I plugged all the wires correctly and the unit didnt even power on. I double and tripple checked everything without sucess, i reconnected my old thermostat and it powered right on, which leads me to believe the unit I purchased is defective. I filed for a refund and will definetely purchase a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo R.

customer_reviews.title: Not a good item.
customer_reviews.text: Order this thermostat and could not get it to connect to wifi. I tried contacting honeywell tech support and they could not solve the issue. I then contacted amazon and they sent me another one. Same issue and then it started turning it self on and off and would not come back on until i removed it from the wall and reconnected it. I do not recommend this item. Honeywell or Amazon was not very helpful with my issues. Which really suprised me that Amazon did not want to do much at all for the inconvenience at all. Offered me a $5 credit. 2 weeks went by and still no working thermostat. Thumbs down.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Spend a Little More on a Better Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to connect with Windows--actually I never did get it connected. The description does not say that you need a "C" wire--only when you open the installation manual does it mention that. The manual also doesn't say what a "C" wire is, or where to get one (you need a separate transformer), which means another wire in the wall. The customer service video was no help, nor was the call-in customer service. I ended up returning it and getting a more expensive, but more user-friendly brand.
customer_reviews.author: curly&moe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wi-fi thermostat !  works superbly
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Easy as pie to connect to your home wi-fi. You can control this thermostat from afar, either via their easy to use Cell app, or their web site via a laptop. My handyman said it was easy and straightforward to install. I have a condo in which I only "live" in part-time, so this wifi thermostat is such a blessing. No more will I arrive to a hot, stuffy unit in the summertime, nor an ice-cold unit in the winter. All's I gotta do now is simply kick on the AC or heat 30 minutes prior to arrival, and voila, I arrive to a comfortable condo unit. Kicking myself for not purchasing this item sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Danno

customer_reviews.title: Great Temperature Control While On Site or Away
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace a 2 wire stat wire with a 3 conductor (actually used 5 conductor) but these keep good temperature control and the Wi-Fi allows me to keep control of the temperatures of different areas of my church from home, on site or my phone. We are using 4 of these thermostats and they are used to also check to make sure the heat is on at the church early Sunday morning without leaving my home. Worth every dollar they cost. They have be running flawlessly for several years now.
customer_reviews.author: James Dewald

customer_reviews.title: True to the line and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my parents so they could monitor their home thermostat while away on vacation or at work. They love it. But the biggest problem I have is the way you link to your device via internet. There is no streamlined app on it's own and you need to log in via the honeywell website and portal. But beggars cannot be choosers and it does exactly as described. The thermostat is also pretty good and accurate. Weve saved on our heating bill since installation. Installation was easy but did require some research as I did not have the 3rd wire this device needed and had to put one in. Biggest hurdle but entirely accomplishable by ones self.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison York

customer_reviews.title: Caveat Emptor - New Company Resideo With Privacy Policy Issues
customer_reviews.text: Use caution when purchasing anything Honeywell. New company Resideo based on spinoff has a real shady privacy policy you must agree to. Used these devices as Honeywell with no issues. Resideo took over, and upon receiving a high temp alert had to accept their very invasive privacy policy to log in and view the alert while traveling. Sent several emails to Honeywell Graham Campbell, Scott Sayres, Chelsea Newberg etc. Only response was from Graham who said he sent my message to Resideo. Numerous messages sent to Resideo - No response. Watch, Resideo as per new privacy EULA as they call it will share, sell your information. DO yourself a favor, look at GoControl or others.
customer_reviews.author: cdmanoise

customer_reviews.title: Pick a different model
customer_reviews.text: This device works fine. re-establishes connectivity to router after a poser failure, no control or feedback issues. My complaint is the size of the readout. The letters are so small I can barely read them at an arm's length. Had I known how small the LCD text was, I would have chosen differently. However, if you have excellent eyes and can walk right up to your device, you may be just fine. Setup was simple. no need for an internal battery, device retains settings if power fails.
customer_reviews.author: HGSR

customer_reviews.title: will not connect to wifi
customer_reviews.text: I tried two different units in my garage to get them to connect to my wifi with no luck. Each time I was on hold with customer service for 45 minutes and they never answered. I tried it with two cell phones and a laptop with the same results. I even tested the 2nd one on my house system (which has a working honeywell wifi thermostat) with the same results. Do not buy this if you want it to hook up to wifi. The temperature control seamed like it would work but i didnt give it a lot of effort.
customer_reviews.author: Scotch740

customer_reviews.title: Beware - horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!! I purchased this one 10 months ago. One night I came home and it was blank. I figured it couldn’t be the thermostat since I had just replaced it. I had the HVAC people out to figure out the issue and it was the thermostat. I’ve tried to call Honeywell multiple times to see about getting it replaced and I’ve had no answer. I wish I wouldn’t have wasted my money on a cheap one and done a more expensive one instead. 10 months is a horrible product life when they are supposed to last 10 years!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mine died after a year and a half.
customer_reviews.text: Mine lasted 1 1/2 years. A chip on the board burned out, and when I got home the screen was blank. The install was easy. The setup with a username and password on Honeywell site was lengthy. But once setup it worked good. I'm ordering a second one. Hope it lasts longer. I use mine with Amazon Alexa. You can only use voice commands to go up or down in temperature. Does not work to turn on and off the device. You either have to get up and physically hit the button on the unit or use the app on your smart device.
customer_reviews.author: Ben in So. Ca

customer_reviews.title: Scheduling is very LIMITED.
customer_reviews.text: In Southern California the electricity rates have been changed recently so that the cheapest rates are from 08:00am to 05:00pm and the highest rates from 5:00pm to 8:00pm. I purchased two of these and then discovered the schedule function does not have an absolute ON or OFF at certain times. Because we are retired and mostly at home I programmed it to away at 5:00pm and back home at 8:00 pm with high cooling setpoint of 95F. Both turn Off at 5:00pm but turns back on at random between 5:00 and 8:00 and then stays on.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Vanniekerk

customer_reviews.title: SOPHISTICATED WIFI SETUP. THERMOSTST
customer_reviews.text: I DO NOT USE ALEXA THUS THE 3 STARS THERE. MY ROOMATE ASSISTED WITH WIFI SETUP DUE TO THE THERMOSTAT BEING TO SOPHISTICATED AND MY PATIENCE DURING THE WIFI SETUP WASN'T QUITE AS STRONG ENOUGH TO LEARN THE WIFI SETUP. I HAVE PERSONAL WEAKNESSES IN THE WIFI DEVICE SETUP CONNECTION AREA, SO PLEASE DON'T LET THIS PART OF MY REVIEW AFFECT YOUR INSTALL/SETUP. MY ROOMMATE CONNECTED TO OUR WIFI IN 35 MINUTES, BUT HE WORKS FOR XFINITY!!!
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my existing thermostat
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my exact same honeywell thermostat with this Wi Fi version one. (Had to buy the C-Wire adapter for the power to go with it ..AC24V C-Wire Power Adapter,LAMMU 24V Power Transformer Requires C-Wire Nest Honeywell Smart WiFi Thermostat Ecobee3 Ecobee4 (16.4ft/5m) ). Since it was an exact replacement I did not even have to change the wall plate and the wiring.. just snapped the top unit on and it worked like a charm. Now I can monitor my thermostat from any where in the world. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nisha D

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to replace the builder grade thermostats because they are wifi. Before I ordered these thermostats I call Honeywell to see if they had a back up battery so they don't need to be reset everytime we have a power blip. Honeywell said that although they don't have a battery they do store the settings in memory. After installing I find that everytime we have a power outage I have to reset the time and schedule. This becomes a PIA when you have four thermostats on four zones. In addition to program the wifi function you best bring a chair because it's a long process.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Frozen busted pipes within a week of installing it quit working.
customer_reviews.text: We have busted water lines because this product failed to work. We installed one in our mountain cabin last week (confirmed they heater worked), after 3 days it stopped turning on the heater. We live in another state and after we received the alert the temperature in cabin fell below 49, we turned heater up from 55 to 73. However, the temperature in the cabin kept falling and pipes froze before we could drive up to the cabin (less then 24 hrs from first alert).
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bistline

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For- This is PERFECT for what it is!
customer_reviews.text: After researching all the newest, fanciest crap out there (some that doesn't even work), I decided to stick with an updated classic. It's a 7 day independent scheduler that allows me the programming I need for my business that's open 4 days/week. I've no need to use the wireless option but the setup is simple. No touch screen or other frills but it's more than enough to ALWAYS turn on the heat and AC. Quite frankly, it's perfect. I bought 3 and installed them myself. Done deal. Happy as could possibly be.
customer_reviews.author: Streamline Industries, Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Works well at controlling your home from remote locations via the APP
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made Unit, connects up like any other thermostat would. Works well on WiFi. The app has a few hoops to jump through when setting up initially, however once you get everything set, you're good. Only issue I've had with this is the APP somethings has "Sessions errors" causing me to wait an hour or so before trying to reconnect to the thermostat. And remember, you are only connecting to the companies server with the app, NOT directly to the thermostat, likewise with the thermostat. Overall, very good product for the price! If you need to manage a property from remote, this unit is a perfect choice!
customer_reviews.author: Sono-sanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price. Not for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: The unit works great. The installation instruction is very clear. Integration with Alexa is seamless. The look is old, but given the price, it is of great value. It is not for everyone since it needs 24V to operate. The old and broken thermostat I have does not have the C wire (24V). I followed the instruction, 1) found a spare wire, 2) found the 24VAC transformer, 3) read the electric diagram of the furnace, 4) connected the spare wire to the proper wire (24VAC out of transformer and went through a capacitor). I am no electrician, but I did work with electrical engineer in the past, so I was comfortable in making the decision.
customer_reviews.author: Yoyo

customer_reviews.title: Beware: does not work with all systems
customer_reviews.text: Because my system also utilizes a Heat Pump this system will not work to replace my current Honeywell controller. Tech support (I tried phone and chat support) from Honeywell was non-existent. I finally called my local heating and cooling contractor to pay them to hook it up and they were not able to make it work with my system so they are quoting me a Honeywell wi-fi unit that will control my heat pump as well. I am sure it works great with more simple systems. I feel like the description should have been more complete possibly, but probably I should have done more research. Now I am stuck with a controller I cannot use.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install mechanically and electrically.  Hard to connect to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these thermostats after going on vacation and forgetting to reset the air conditioning last year. I found them easy to install and connect to the furnaces. The procedure for connecting to WiFi is cumbersome and when the WiFI goes out and connection is lost, they sometimes do not reconnect automatically. So, I have to relearn the procedure all over again and this can be time consuming and frustrating. Otherwise, they work fine and I enjoy being able to monitor and change the temperature settings from my cell phone or my computer. Good price at the time of purchase, but I do not know if they are still available.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Support answered the phone to discuss no C wire on system with red and white wires. 24 volt transformer can substitute for C wire. Tech support provided wrong wiring; figured it out by trial and error. Good app and easy to set-up wifi connection. Cons: Losing power required time reset at unit. Reders unit unreliable if off site when power goes out. Only 4 program modes during the day. Old Honeywell non-wifi had 6 during the day which worked better with life-style. Hour house has 10 thermostats. Decided one did not provide enough remote control and 10 would have been too costly.
customer_reviews.author: Mapache Basura

customer_reviews.title: WiFi Setup Does not Work!
customer_reviews.text: In order to connect this thermostat to your home Wifi network to use with either the App, Online control, or Alexa you have to connect a phone or other computing device to the built-in WiFi setup network. While I could connect to the built-in WiFi setup network it would not open the setup page on multiple devices using multiple browsers on each device. I followed All the trouble shooting steps on Honeywell's support pages and all the instructions (which were the same) from their support tech and it just would not work. I sent it back for a refund so I could buy Wifi Thermostat that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: ColoDad

customer_reviews.title: Use phone app to adjust while you are away!
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased 2 of these for our home. The old ones were working but were quite discolored and ugly. These arrived promptly and he was able to quickly install both. (He is very capable of home projects, I'm not sure what the experience would be for someone less "handy"). They operate perfectly as far as we can tell, which has been about 1 month now. Extra features that we use/appreciate include the backlit screen when in use, and the ability to adjust the thermostat by using a phone app. We are very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Rates

customer_reviews.title: Cannot adjust the cycle rate!
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this thermostat, EXCEPT you cannot adjust the temperature differential, otherwise known as the cycle rate, it is factory set to +/- 0.5 degree, which to me is useless. Furnace was cycling way to often. I can`t imagine what the A/C woud do. This was unacceptable so I sent it back. The app was great, and very user friendly. I bought the Emerson Sensi Smart and it allows you to adjust the cycle rate to slow, med, fast. I don`t like the app and wifi set up I found a little confusing but it works.
customer_reviews.author: HVAC Test

customer_reviews.title: Simple, cheap, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I didn't need a smart learning thermostat, just one I could control from phone via app and computer. This is perfect for that, cheap, works well, doesnt look like some new tacky tech garbage, easy installation. I read all the reviews too and was concerned about the temperature interval that others mentioned being unchangable and set at 1 degree. I found that it operates my air conditioner at the same frequency and rate of operation as my previous honeywell wall thermostat. It works fine and this is a non-issue. After a couple months using this, I have not had any issues with losing wifi connectivity. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Slider821

customer_reviews.title: Tried two both had problems
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these as Amazon reconditioned, first one did not match wouldn't connect with heater, and screen went blank and second unit did connect with heater and online but would not shut off, in both cases I spent hours online with Honeywell/Resideo and finally told by them that they appeared to be bad units and to send them back, Theyy checked the serial numbers and said they were both 2012 units. I have purchased other manufacturer's reconditioned items through Amazon before with no problems or complaints, but these just couldn't cut it.
customer_reviews.author: SnP. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Wifi thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year and finally installed it last week. Install was smooth and app is easy to use. I like the ability to see what the temperature is and adjust it while away from home. One thing I don't like (and was hoping for) is that this doesnt switch between heat and cool automatically. There is only heat, cool or off setting. Will update review as needed.
customer_reviews.author: B Shumway

customer_reviews.title: Should have done it sooner, trust me, do it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, use. Makes life so easy. My folks are older and now can operate easily at wall & phone, the older one that came with the house 1990s tech was impossible to operate. Simple to use, and can be used from thousands of miles from home. Went out of town and turned A/C off, reactivated A/C and cooled home down before arriving back home,doesn't get better than that.
customer_reviews.author: Toby McCrory

customer_reviews.title: Do your research before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and to connect to the internet - but it does NOT allow you to change the cycle rate. It had my air conditioner cycling every 10-15 seconds! There was no way I was going to keep it. If you are installing this, it is my opinion that it is better to pay more money up front for a thermostat that allows you to make cycle adjustments than to pay an outrageous electric bill from the constant cycling every month.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping for Fun

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE RISK
customer_reviews.text: Product doesn't work with all “common wires” like they said it would. Called my electrician and he said that I would need to rewire my unit to get this product to work with my house. Overall, it would coast and arm and leg. Tried to send back but the sender made me pay for the shipping. It would coast me little under half of the product coast in shipping from sender, back to sender. Lesson learned from another third party AMAZON SELLER! NOT WORTH THE RISK!
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Wifi enabled thermostat works well
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and easy to install if you have a C wire. My application did not but I do have and unused blue wire which I used to connect to the C wire terminal at the furnace and the thermostat. I would caution people to work out the details regarding the C wire before purchasing as installation can get quite technical rather quickly. Many different heating systems and wiring installations are in use today that can complicate a thermostat replacement. I love the app for my phone and laptop. It makes programming and notifications simple

customer_reviews.title: A couple of unfixable issues
customer_reviews.text: Occasionally loses WiFi connection, and it's a bit of an ordeal getting it back. Tech support is hit or miss. One told me I had to change my WiFi password, that you can't use special characters; luckily I called back, because the second tech told me that was a resolved issue, luckily before I had to reset approx. 40 devices in my home. As others have mentioned, this thermostat cycles every couple of minutes. It has caused a severe strain on our HVAC system, with BOTH fans failing within 2 months of installing this. There is no workaround for this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this. The website is constantly being updated and the app doesn't work for hours and now days and weeks of software updates. I bought the thermostat for remote control for me not for Honeywell to control my thermostat which happens too much. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Syrophoen

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry to say that this thermostat was open prior to receiving. since everything looked to be intact I decided to install it anyway. This stat did not work. Backlight came on but that was it. I tried another Honeywell that I have and it worked fine. I'm thinking it was returned and then turned right back out for sale.
customer_reviews.author: GregS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, easy to use, works great
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a "more affordable" WiFi thermostat. This fit the bill nicely. It does exactly what I need it to. The Total Connect Comfort app is good - basic, but works well. I have a very old gas unit heater in our second house, and in the winter/cold months, it's nice to be able to keep it at a moderately cool temperature when not in use, and heat it to a comfortable temperature before going there. Very pleased with this product. Note: My old thermostat with the mercury bulb switch had two wires, so I did purchase the 24VAC adapter to power this. Plenty of wiring diagrams can be found online to explain.
customer_reviews.author: C. Granger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and Program
customer_reviews.text: Precise temperature control, appears to be plus or minus 0.5 degree. Most, even electronic thermostats are plus or minus one degree. Installation instructions are extremely clear and well-written. Package includes wire labels. Really easy to connect to the internet with a laptop. (I did not try using a smartphone.) The user interface, both on the front panel and on the Android app , are easy to use. I'm a professional Control Systems Engineer, and I admire good design, and this impressed me. I did not want or need a "learning" thermostat, as I am retired and my schedule is irregular, and this one works well for a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Byron L. Postma

customer_reviews.title: Best Value WiFi Thermostat / Controller
customer_reviews.text: It took a bit of research to match the wiring to my existing setup, but once this was done, it has worked fine since. Whilst I have just set it and let it do it's own thing, I do like being able to change settings from anywhere where I can get an internet signal. The app is easy to use. There can be a time lag from programming over the internet to the device getting the update.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Morley

customer_reviews.title: I really am happy to have replaced a Honeywell non-programmable thermostat with this ...
customer_reviews.text: I really am happy to have replaced a Honeywell non-programmable thermostat with this one. While I didn't think it mattered much at first, the scheduled programming really does save by changing settings daily over the week. More importantly, when I travel, I can really make big changes in temps and change them back a few hours before coming home and the house in at a perfect temp. Easy to install, program, download app and make changes.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Davis

customer_reviews.title: Setup can be confusing, read the manual!
customer_reviews.text: Initial setup can be confusing unless you follow the manual very carefully. If you do that you should be ok. It helps to know exactly what kind of AC unit you have at your home too. The app / website scheduler and control is great! The only problem with it was one day when the internet at my home went out while I was gone. The email from the Honeywell site to tell me there was a problem was nice at first but... I got 1 an hour for 9 hours.. Honeywell -- fix that. I had to turn that off, I don't need to know my thermostat lost its connection to the internet every hour.
customer_reviews.author: mkztg

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Service and Bad Account Setup
customer_reviews.text: It is okay as a thermostat but the internet interface requires creating an account at Honeywell (I hate all of these stupid accounts - they are not necessary) and the Honeywell system does not properly send emails so my email provider treats their emails as fraudulent and does not deliver them. Result, I cannot create an account. Honeywell also requires too much information and has a totally unreasonable 'privacy' statement. Customer service is non-existent. No response from them at all. Call in and you get a brain dead person that is clueless and asks stupid, unnecessary, questions. I wish I had never bought this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Defective unit?
customer_reviews.text: Installed it according to the instructions and it did not function when we tried to turn the cool air on. Consulted our AC guy and was reading some articles, it all points towards a defective unit. Put the old unit up and it works fine. Will try another one sometime and will update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my phone!
customer_reviews.text: This thermostat is great! The best part is the WiFi control on my phone. I can check on it when I’m gone and the best part is turning on my thermostat while I’m laying in bed, so cool! Was not hard to install and I had to install a C wire too. I don’t have Alexa so I can’t give it a rating.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this thermostat so far. Very simple to program using the app for 7 days. The app will walk you through wake up times and desired temps, away times etc. I mainly wanted this so I could control my thermostat when I am not home. Recently went to Alaska and left the AC on at a higher temp than normal because I did not want to come back to a 100 degree house. Wish I had this thermostat in time for that trip. My only criticism is the instructions are not very good in terms of installing and setting up the wifi connection. I figured it out but the instructions definitely need improvement.
customer_reviews.author: David Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent but does not report temperature in the house. Too bad, otherwise great.
customer_reviews.text: I easily replaced a similar non-WiFi Honeywell thermostat with this one. I was able to easily connect the needed "C-Wire" just as explained in the instructions without "hurting myself" or breaking anything. It was really easy. This does work great with Alexa and my cell phone (Android). It will NOT report the current temperature in the room. Too bad, I like to know if things are working well without walking over to the thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: FAILED after ten months warranty, won't repair or replace
customer_reviews.text: Loved it for ten months, internal failure in unit blew fuse in ac unit. Warranty won't repair or replace as this is a 2018 model bought and installed in April 2019. Only covered from date of manufacturing, not date of purchase. This took 27 minutes on hold to find out apparently I should have confirmed it wasn't "old" when I bought it. Worst customer service I've had in a long time! Had to reinstall old non wifi based thermostat to get ac working again. Also Honeywell btw...can Amazon help?
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT E GREISER

customer_reviews.title: Great Experience - Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This device worked perfectly. Sure you need to hook up the C wire. Big deal. There are extra wires between the furnace and the thermostat. I simply took the black wire and hooked it up to the "C" terminal plainly marked on my HVAC unit and then connected it to the C on the thermostat side. I was up and running in under 20 minutes and that included getting the Amazon Echo online too. As for cycling the HVAC too often like I saw in other reports, I'd say that this device cycles way less than the builder device I had that came with the house. Don't believe the negative reviews this device is "all that".
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFTW

customer_reviews.title: Like the Wifi
customer_reviews.text: It works well, but you have to be careful on setup. if your system is complicated at all be very careful to pay attention to the wiring and that attention to the wiring is important in the final setup in the programmable functions. It took a couple of calls to tech support and asking an hvac pro before I got it right.
customer_reviews.author: uffelmad

customer_reviews.title: Great, when it works
customer_reviews.text: This thermostat works great, when the backend servers are working. The backend servers that this device depends on are woefully unstable unfortunately. Obviously you can adjust it manually while you are in the house, but using voice control, or things like IFTTT won't work while the backend servers are down. I had to pull a second star off after the control program for Google Home was completely broken for a few weeks. It seems Honeywell realized their system was a failure as well, because they seem to have sold off their smart device division to some company I've never heard of. Probably better to save your money and get one of those Bee things or a Nest.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: I had a Honeywell thermostat very similar to this one already it just wasn’t Wi-Fi enabled. I bought this one because I thought it would be an easy set up. However I said it up and it didn’t work. I made two separate calls to Honeywell customer service and wasn’t able to get it to work. They blamed my compressor and said it wasn’t working. However when I put my old thermostat back on it worked just fine. I’m returning this and will go with another thermostat brand.
customer_reviews.author: Erik W.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a month
customer_reviews.text: Received Dec. 30th. Installed beginning of year and by beginning of Feb, our furnace wouldn't come on. Replaced furnace thinking that was the problem ($1650). New furnace wouldn't kick in. Replaced with different thermostat and furnace is working fine. Technician said was probably thermostat that blew computer board in our furnace.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Payne

customer_reviews.title: Return issue
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this thermostat installed it and it would not work. We notified the seller who promptly sent a replacement asking us to return the original. After receiving the replacement we found the first one was working. We then returned the replacement per instructions. We received notice that they did receive the return and would not give us a credit as it was the original replacement. Several days later we received an email that they DID NOT receive the replacement and charged our credit card. I give customer support low rating until resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Accurate reading, love the WiFi and not having to get up out of bed to adjust temp
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Thermostat. Its easy to install, durable quality and the back light helps a lot when trying to see it in the dark. The WiFi makes it so that we can see the a/c working while we're on vacation since we have a pet at home. The unit also tells you what the internal house temperature is so know the pet is safe. The Thermostat sensing is strong and will show an accurate reading unlike the previous Hunter we had which made the A/C run nonstop all day long running up our bill. Again, the WiFi is awesome, you can download the app and control it from your bed without having to get up to adjust it.
customer_reviews.author: H&J B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed having a smart thermostat. It's very quick to respond and the setup could not have been easier. The thermostat communicates with Honeywell, so most of the setup for smart control configuration happens on the Honeywell website. Once the WiFi network was connected, it was a breeze to link the thermostat to a Honeywell online account. From there you can use a web browser or the app to program the thermostat and ask your Alexa to make temperature adjustments along with giving you it's current status.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron H.

customer_reviews.title: Painless Changeover
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched out my "dumb" thermostat for a "smart, wifi" thermostat (Honeywell RTH6580WF) . The changeover went painlessly (the old thermostat was also a Honeywell) and only took about 30 minutes from start to programming complete. The thermostat joined my wireless network without any problems. BE AWARE - the default IP address of the thermostat is 192.168.1.1, so if your wireless router uses 192.168.1.1 you may have an IP conflict initially. My wireless network is NOT on 192.168.1.x. The Android app works great on both my tablet and cell phone. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: cdveal

customer_reviews.title: so that I can walk into a comfortable house. Easy installation with good instructions
customer_reviews.text: I can adjust my thermostat from miles away on my cell phone. If I forget to bump the AC up before I leave the house, no problem, just open the app. I can also get the air or heat going when I’m on my way home, so that I can walk into a comfortable house. Easy installation with good instructions. Plus you can YouTube any finer details you may need. The app was a challenge to install due to bugs, but the company continues to refine and improve it over time. I’ve had no porblems with it in the past year. There is also a browser-based access that has never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: Directions are poor or just don't work for wifi connection
customer_reviews.text: Easy to program but connecting to wifi did not happen. Opening the thermostat link on my laptop did not open a webpage, and the web address listed does not exist. I would love to find someone who can install this for me or get newer instructions, because the ones provided do not work.
customer_reviews.author: Gaia

customer_reviews.title: EE Error Code after 2 Months - Defective
customer_reviews.text: MAN I'm just so bummed this thing already failed on me after two months. It threw the EE error code on me, so I checked my HVAC system to make sure it's the actually the thermostat and sure enough, my HVAC system is fine. I tried plugging this in after a minute without power and it immediately throws the EE error code. So this thing is now a brick, and I get to deal with the most annoying call waiting system Honeywell has set up. Before this thing failed, it was awesome. Loved that I can tweak the themostat on the fly from my phone, anywhere. Until I woke up this morning freezing my diamond sharp nipples off...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best "simple" and smart thermostat
customer_reviews.text: It's a no-hassle easy to use, wifi connected thermostat. Setup might be a bit long, but once connected, everything else just flows nicely. It has 4 different times to setup temperature each day, and you can provide either an individual day or a multi-day setup. It also has an alert system (connection and/or temperature) and separate fan program (auto, circulate or on). The app and website are functional and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Schumy

customer_reviews.title: Great for months then quit.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple months, now in the deep of winter it stops working. Will turn on and run the heat for about 1 minute before shutting off again. We never had this problem with our furnace before installing this unit. Was purchased it to control temperature while away from home. Restarting the thermostat causes the heat to kick back on for another minute before it dies again. Furthermore the app doesnt work if the Honeywell website is down.
customer_reviews.author: H. F.

customer_reviews.title: not Happy-wish i could give negative stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a server based system that relies on it for control, had thermostat 2 weeks and worked fine, honeywell servers failed 1 evening while out of town, so no control remotely. after Honeywell resumed servers service,thermostat would not turn on heater, nearly had frozen pipes. was out of town at the time of failure. a thermostat should be 100% percent reliable, especially when wifi feature is being used. Never again Honeywell, never again
customer_reviews.author: Rick Mattioda

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality only last a year
customer_reviews.text: Very bad quality it last only a little more than a year (warranty expired) I bought two of this thermostat, luckily I bought insurance on first one so insurance paid for the replacement after it died , 2nd one died few days ago after 14,15 months, don’t buy it, pay few bucks more to get better one
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Guan

customer_reviews.title: I usually don't write reviews, but I just wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write reviews, but I just wanted to share my experience. I owned this for about 6 months, the wifi connection keeps failing 2 or 3 times a month. And the setup is a pain after it fails, won't be as simple as the initial setup. I had to search a Youtube video to learn how to reset it first in order to set up the wifi connection again. Today it failed again and it's the3rd time this month. Unfortunately, this time I couldn't get the wifi to work anymore and it's now in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: yng

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertized
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily with clear directions. Work remotely with cell phone. Installed in second home in the mountains so we can monitor the heat in the winter when not there and turn it on as needed or set it on hold. We also use it to heat the house up to a comfortable temperature a few hours before we arrive. Works fine as a programmable thermostat and no issues over the network. Initial programming takes a bit of time since each day of the week needs to be programmed individually, even if they are the same.
customer_reviews.author: WoodArtist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I didn't install this myself - my contractor did. With the price and the functions and ability to tie into wifi - this is a great product. I can set the heating / air conditioning temp remotely through my phone or pc. Honeywell also provides energy use statistics.
customer_reviews.author: mmmmmmm

customer_reviews.title: Not WiFi friendly
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always had Honeywell thermostats in the past and have had no problems. Now that most household items are WiFi capable I wanted to add my thermostat to the mix. I have many devices that are connected to my home WiFi with no issues. Even with the help of Honeywell support this device would not connect. The unit was centrally located with a strong signal, but with hours of trying we could not get it connected. Reading all of the other complaints with this unit it is obvious that Honeywell is not WiFi friendly.
customer_reviews.author: RLB

customer_reviews.title: It works fine.
customer_reviews.text: We had an issue when first installing the thermostat and spent about 3 hours trying too refusal register it too our account. Come to find out the website was down and we wasted a lot of time trying to figure out what we did wing wrong or if it actually required a hub to connect as we kept getting a "gateway" error. Turns out we did everything perfectly right and after a couple of hours on hold waiting for a customer support rep they confirmed it was the website and added the Mac address manually. Would be a 5 Stars rating if it wasn't for that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Stafford

customer_reviews.title: installation problems, Honeywell does not back up anything from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Screws between R and RC were tightened down so hard that it was impossible to untighten them to attach the wires from the system. After over a half hour waiting on line with Honeywell, I finally got someone who asked where I got this. I said Amazon. He said "Oh" and then said, in essence, that they don't back up anything from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: John W. B.

customer_reviews.title: Programmable and App controllable
customer_reviews.text: Works great 90% of the time, what will drive you nuts is that the Honeywell servers will be down or under maintenance and they dont give you a heads up so the app will show all kinds of wrong information. The actual unit still works and will follow the schedule but the app will be useless. The down side is that all the changes you made when the server was down will cache and then hit the system all at once, so there is no telling what it will end up with once its cleared up. I do have 2 of them, one for my house and one for my church.
customer_reviews.author: WilliamS.

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great product that is easy to use and saves money. I wanted a smart thermostat that wasn't nest thermostat price. It's great that you can adjust it from your phone via the app that is easy to use. It took me more time setting up the internet as I had to split my router into 2.4ghz and 5ghz than it did to install it on the wall. I had a Honeywell already and the fittings were already standard width so putting the base plate was merely a matter of replacement. I had all the wiring marked and fitted properly so everything was a easy change over.
customer_reviews.author: sal

customer_reviews.title: not user friendly to install for a non tech.
customer_reviews.text: Finally got it installed and we can't join up with my wifi. Rejects my password that I know is correct and Honeywell was not much help. Called ISP, linksys, Honeywell still no luck. Called amazon and they will send a e-mail to Wiki Deals and have them get a hold of me. Return has expired even though I just installed yesterday. All three said the thermostat must be the problem and to return it. Will update on how it works out. amazon stepped up and will allow me to return
customer_reviews.author: robert m.

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup! Perfect
customer_reviews.text: For the price, being able to control this thing by WiFi is a must!! I had a nest for quite some time and then we sold our house. The new home we purchased did not have a WiFi thermostat. I started researching and gave this a chance! It works much better than expected!!
customer_reviews.author: JN292

customer_reviews.title: Cycles too much
customer_reviews.text: This device is awful. It turns on and off too frequently when cooling. As stated by other reviews it is hard coded at .5 temperature differential and cannot be adjusted. Very frustrating having to play around with the thermostat so much to be comfortable. I also feel it is off by a few degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Londell Boyd Sr

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had an old one exactly like this, same brand, but without the wifi capability. Installing the new one was very easy and I have been very happy since. It is so convenient to be able to monitor the temperature inside/outside and the desired temperature, especially when you are away for more then just a few days. I bought two of these, the other one that was replaced is a heat pump system. Installation took a couple of extra steps and a phone call to customer support (which was great) and it's been working fine. I have been using these for about 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar T Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished model was fine -11/11/2018 see update also
customer_reviews.text: Refurbished model was fine, only problem was no manual in English. Partly blame Honeywell. Who doesn't print multi language instructions in current times? Got on internet and figured it out. Pleased with the product and the refurbished price Update 11/11/2018 did not need heat here in the South and I failed to set it up properly since I did not get a user guide with the tstat when it came and one I got was in Spanish. Downloaded the appropriate manual and finished identifying my correct configuration. Info in the user guide (not quick start) may be essential to correct start up
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Complicated & no tech help if heat pump
customer_reviews.text: My handyman had trouble installing it - I have a heat pump etc. - so we called tech support. Clearly off-shore with a script. I didn’t want to be rude to the poor woman. There was a man advising her and we were told we could not speak directly to him. Since we had disconnected the old unit and couldn’t reconnect it correctly at that point I used my fireplace for two weeks rather than pay extra for a premium visit outside my heater company maintenance contract. It took the tech from my heater company over 1.5 hours: over $100 even with discount. Only good part is that it now works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: PatriciaKathleen

customer_reviews.title: Do not use for vacation property. Looses wifi and you have be there to reset. Poor design. Not re
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these. One for my mountain cabin and 2 as a gift for my son so he could monitor and adjust settings on peak days and avoid steep penalties. Temp at the cabin will be in the teens the next few days. I went on line to make sure system is on but no connection. To correct I have to pull the stat and reinstall. This is twice now it has failed. Last time it was down for two weeks. Thank goodness system was working; hope it is this time. I am looking for a reliable replacement for all three. Too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product works great but setup a little tricky.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a great product after the first month of use. The wiring setup can be challenging but after you figure out which type system you have, there are you tube videos that show you exactly how to do it. After the wiring was complete, I was only getting warm air when the "cool" function was on. Had to call tech support and there are several settings they have to talk you through depending on what kind of system you have. A little time consuming and the book doesn't cover that step ! Setting up the link to Alexa was a breeze !!
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to control our upstairs a/c without having to go upstairs to check it. It works great. We have it scheduled to change temperatures 4 times a day. We are also able to change the schedule from day to day or from weekday to weekend. We use the the Apple app on our phone to check the temperature and adjust if we need to. It also sends us an email if the temp goes above or below what we have it set for and when it goes back to the set schedule. I wish it would send a notification that would make it so much better. It was super easy to install and set up.
customer_reviews.author: fun4mereading

customer_reviews.title: Great thermostat, easy installation, very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and configure. I have three zones in my house and I have set up and installed 3 of these thermostats. The issue is that you need to create an account on Honeywell site for which I used my email address. I have control of all 3 thermostats and it works like a charm. The reason for 4 stars is because if I want to give the control to someone else in the house, I need to share my login details with them. I haven't been able to find a way to let them create a new account so that they can manage the thermostat on their level without using my credentials to log in.
customer_reviews.author: Clinomaniac

customer_reviews.title: Great thermostat
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth purchase of this Honeywell unit (different locations). I love these units. It has been especially great for my 97 year old mother. She can't see the thermostat anymore, but she can call me and tell me she is hot or cold and wants an adjustment. And saves us bunches of money at our lake house. We no longer heat or cool unnecessarily when we are not there, but can have the house the temperature we want prior to arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  WiFi setup can be tricky if WiFi security not set up correctly!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Easy install since I was replacing another Hopewell thermostat with c wire already there. 4 stars because I did have some issues connecting to my wifi. Earlier review saved me there! WiFi must be open network or using WPA2-PSK AES security (which usually is the default security settings for WiFi these days). I had changed mine to just WPA-PSK prior and the thermostat wouldn't recognize my wifi security. Also userid and password for WiFi must be 13 letters or less. If either is longer than that, the thermostat won't see your WiFi security too. After fixing those issues everything works great! Would buy again, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jon b

customer_reviews.title: Great convenience for the money
customer_reviews.text: The Nest is just too overpriced to be worth it to me personally so I chose this one. Was easy to install (in fact it popped right onto my Honeywell backplate without having to install this new one) and program and love being able to control my temp from anywhere in the world via my phone or desktop. There are times when their servers lose communication but hasn't been too often, and I remind myself in the grand scheme of things, having to walk up to change the thermostat isn't that big of a deal whatsoever. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Faricy

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a year
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this to be honest. It worked well and I never had any issues with it. Then one day i had to change the password to my wifi and everything changed. I followed the steps online and the book to rest it and it took the password and everything, then just stopped working. I thought it was my actual AC unit because it was just blowing hot air out. Called for service call the guy checked it out and then saw my thermostat and messed with and said it was broken. He even followed the steps to set the password and it still read everything wrong. Just disappointing, now im looking for another wifi thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly W

customer_reviews.title: I like this unit!
customer_reviews.text: Needed to get one of these for our home. It was fairly easy to install if you understand basic wiring both at the control unit and the furnace. The steps to set it up are a little daunting, but reading and following the directions is key. However, it does disconnect from the Internet sometimes. It's no big deal as the heat runs on the settings you program without internet connection. If it does disconnect, they tell you to do this and go here and try this etc. However, just unplugging your internet and plugging it back in reconnects it automatically every time.
customer_reviews.author: deand

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this to replace an OLD thermostat, wanting to have control from my iPhone. Then I bought the Sensi thermostat because it had more features. After installing the Sensi, there were many problems with getting a stable themperature. So I returned the Sensi (it was more expensive) and installed this one. After some mistakes by me, I got it working as it should. Sure glad I decided to use this Honeywell thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Trekman

customer_reviews.title: App is super convenient & great quality
customer_reviews.text: We are one step closer to having a smart house! Was an easy install and we were up and running in a few minutes. The app is super intuitive and I can check the temperature and adjust through the day depending on when I leave work or if the dog is in the house. Very happy with this. Was considering buying the Nest but this gives much of that functionality for a much better price. The wifi programmable suits our needs. My advice to anyone purchasing a thermostat is check what wires you have before ordering any thermostat to see what's comparable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stable temp
customer_reviews.text: The thermostat keeps my house temp stable. My rental came with a 20 yr old mechanical thermostat and temps would swing from one extreme to other. This really did the trick and love the wifi capability and being able to control the HVAC system remotely. I only give it 4 stars due to it the wifi being a pain to setup. Took me over 20 attempts to get it to connect to my network! But it's a good value overall and recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Illusive0ne

customer_reviews.title: Setting scheduled is unreliable!!!
customer_reviews.text: When I fist installed it, I was just turning it on and off on demand. For the summer I have been trying to set a schedule where it changes target temperatures at different times of the day. I'm using the app to set the schedule. It looks like the schedule is there, even when I go to the unit and look at the schedule, it sets the schedule that I intended. But at 6pm (which is not in the program) it is going to a new temperature. This may have been a scheduled time/temperaters that I set once upon a time, but it's now what I see now. This seems like a bug.
customer_reviews.author: David from Irvine, CA

customer_reviews.title: This is a comfort success
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I left home for a day and forgot to turn off the air condition unit. I thought to myself that my bill was going to be sky high and had no way of turning it off. I was told that Honeywell had a WI-Fi thermostat and it was simple to install. I purchased two one for upstairs and one for downstairs. I can now control my unit from the app on my phone. I thought I was going to need someone to install them but I was able to replace both units on my own.
customer_reviews.author: hoopinonyou

customer_reviews.title: Brand New, Could Not Power On
customer_reviews.text: We have a working C wire, however, this brand new unit simply could not get any incoming electric power after all proper connections made. I uninstalled and reinstalled multiple times in 2 days, still no power, making me believe my C wire is not working. I then installed an used Emerson smart thermostat, it works right away! Needless to say, I returned this Honeywell to Amazon and got my money back.
customer_reviews.author: M. Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: We live in the desert and travel during the summer. It is great to be able to check on our home's temperature while we are away and it's even better to be able to lower the temperature with my phone hours before we return home so we can enter a nice cool home. It was easy to install and has the features I want for not too much money. We stayed at someone's house for 3 months that had a Nest and it was to invasive for me. I don't need my thermostat to learn my habits.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney B.

product_meta.title: Honeywell Home Wi-Fi 7-Day Programmable Thermostat (RTH6580WF), Requires C Wire, Works with Alexa
product_meta.description: Style:ThermostatConnect your home's HVAC system to the rest of your wireless network easily with a Honeywell 7 day Programmable Wi-Fi enabled THERMOSTAT. This high-tech unit has 7 fully Programmable days, with morning, daytime, evening, and night, and easy connectivity for control by smartphone or computer. On the THERMOSTAT, there's a big, backlit digital display and easy controls. Automatic software updates. WiFi Specifications - 802.11b, 802.11g, 802.11n, 2.4GHz range
feature_bullets: THERMOSTAT THAT FITS YOUR LIFE. 7-day, 4 periods per day, flexible programming lets you sync your comfort with your schedule.
EASY-TO-USE-APP. Choose from the Total Connect Comfort app or the Honeywell Home app to control your WiFi thermostat anytime, anywhere.
SMART HOME INTEGRATION. The Wi-Fi 7-Day is compatible with voice assistant devices like Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, Microsoft Cortana, and more.
SIMPLE INSTALL FOR A DIY PROJECT. The Wi-Fi 7-Day Programmable Thermostat is easy to configure and install yourself.
EFFICIENCY AND REWARDS. The Wi-Fi 7-Day works with utility programs across the US to bring you even more savings.
EASY OPERATION AND INTUITIVE. Big, backlit digital display and easy controls make for a user-friendly experience.
SMART ALERTS HELP YOU WORRY LESS. Get air filter change reminders, temperature notifications, internet connection alerts, and more.
LEARNS YOUR COMFORT LEVELS. Smart Response feature learns your home's cycles to help deliver the right temperature.
ENERGY STAR CERTIFIED. Honeywell Home Wi-Fi thermostats are energy-efficient without sacrificing performance.
HELPS SAVE MONEY AND ENERGY. You can program energy savings when you’re away and comfort when you return.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,670 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
